comment.body:
Can you add support for the Tor  Browser Bundle?
Right now Framework.js is broken for TBB users.

@╲⎝⧹ⓜⓔⓢⓠⓤⓘⓣⓐ⧸⎠╱: 
- The ions are not displayed(it looks like a css file not being loaded somewhere)
- The file and zeronet download buttons look really weird.

Not really a bug, but a security consideration:
On page load connections to clearnet are being made to:
- plasnerd.github.io
- img.shields.io

This exposes every user of the zite to the sites and leaks information to them(as example IP-addresses and referrer, that tells the site that zeronet has been used). Which is problematic since github is now microsoft and(as a platform) *cannot* be trusted anymore.
There are probably a few more things I overlooked since I don't know the structure of framework.js, but I highly recommend downloading the [Tor Browser Bundle](https://www.torproject.org/download/download-easy.html.en)(clearnet) and debugging it code on there, too.

In my point of view:
Religion was necessary in the past to keep a large group of people stable. Nowadays we have a good set of morals and rules, under which we know, that a large number of people can reasonably live. These rules no longer require a magical being of infinite+1 power to keep you from breaking those rules, because the laws and governments, that enforce them, already take that place(a mighty enemy(?) that you cannot overcome). 
This holds true for any religion, you have a set of rules to keep a big population of people stable, a set of rules that guarantee the survival of the religion and a set of miscellaneous rules that are often specific to one given religion.
You could also put their source on [GitCenter](/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t), if you want.
